page.title: 02NEW ERA STUD FARM.
page.content: Mr. and Mrs.Bamford rent the farm, which had once been on the estate of Lord Leigh, from Mr. Bamford's uncle. They have done for eleven years.His uncle taught the skills of farming because his father hadn't been a farmer.Mr.Bamford had many jobs before going into farming.His ambition is to breed a Cheltenham Gold Cup winner.Mr.Bamford's farm is a stud farm and has 13 horses including the foals.He doesn't use any machinery and has used the same method for working all the time he has rented the farm. He used to have sheep on his farm but he changed them for cattle.He employs one person full-time and three people part-time.There are 8 mares,5 foals and 1 stallion.The foals are given nicknames and when they are a year old they are given racing names.They sell for 1,000-3,000 pounds.
